parsetree.*:
<root><br>
<template lineStart="1"><title>Command</title><part><name>Comments</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> arma2 </value></part><part><name>Game name</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00</value></part><part><name>Game version</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Teams </value></part><part><name>GROUP1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>gr2</name>=<value> Object Detection </value></part><part><name>GROUP2</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Return a list of agents in the current mission. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''agents''' </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER2</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name>p3</name>=<value> </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER3</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Array]] of [[Team Member|Team Members]]</value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value> 


</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>{[[agent]] _x [[moveTo]] [[position]] [[player]]} [[forEach]] '''agents''';</code></value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value> 

____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value> [[agent]], [[createAgent]], [[isAgent]], [[forEachMemberAgent]], [[entities]], [[allCurators]], [[allGroups]], [[allDead]], [[playableUnits]], [[switchableUnits]], [[vehicles]], [[allUnitsUAV]], [[allDeadMen]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value> 

</value></part><part><name index="7"/><value>  </value></part><part><name>MPBEHAVIOUR</name>=<value> 
____________________________________________________________________________________________
</value></part></template>

<h3 style='display:none'>Notes</h3>
<dl class='command_description'>
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment><dd class="notedate">Posted on April 4, 2012 - 10:48 (GMT)
<dt class="note">[[User:Rocket|Rocket]]
<dd class="note">Note that agents returns a reference to the agent itself, not the object. For example: '''{alive _x} count agents;''' would return an error. But you can assign the agent a reference using setVariable, and then reference it, for example: '''{alive (_x getVariable ["agentObject",objNull]) count agents;''' would return the number of agents still alive - BUT you would need to define "agentObject" after you create the agent, for example: 
'''_agent = createAgent [_type, _position, [], _radius, "NONE"];_agent setVariable["agentObject",_agent,true];'''

<dd class="notedate">Posted on August 1, 2013 - 21:55 (GMT)
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone_Kid|Killzone_Kid]]
<dd class="note">Alternatively, to get object from agent reference use [[agent]] command.

<dd class="notedate">Posted on May 26, 2020 - 14:10 (GMT)
<dt class="note">[[User:PierreMGI|PierreMGI]]
<dd class="note">In debug console, pointing at an agent:<br>
{| class="wikitable"
|-
| ''[[cursorObject]]'' || // seems to refer to an agent (ex.: Agent 0xcbce41c0), but it is an object
|-
| ''[[teamMember]] cursorObject'' || // returns the same value Agent 0xcbce41c0, but now it is the agent
|-
| ''cursorObject in [[Agents]]'' || // so, will return false (even if you can read the value Agent 0xcbce41c0 in the agents array)
|-
| ''teamMember cursorObject in Agents'' || // returns true. TeamMember allows to refer to the agent under the cursorObject
|-
| ''[[agent]] teamMember cursorObject isEqualTo cursorObject'' || // True, same object.
|}
<br>

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
